subject: Sexual Health
title: The Diaphragm and Cervical Cap
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Diaphragm and Cervical Cap.

hook.text: A flexible dome placed over the cervix blocks sperm from entering the uterus during intercourse.

buildup.text: Diaphragms have been used since the 1880s and were the primary female-controlled method for decades.

discovery.text: Used with spermicide, diaphragms are about 88% effective with typical use at preventing pregnancy.

twist.text: The rise of the pill in the 1960s made diaphragms seem outdated, but they require no hormones at all.

climax.text: For people avoiding hormones, barrier methods like diaphragms offer a reliable non-hormonal alternative.

punchline.text: No hormones needed. Just a well-placed barrier.

quiz.question: How effective is the diaphragm with typical use?
